column2: GitHub Copilot is an AI-powered pair programmer that suggests code completions directly in the editor while you write your code in Visual Studio Code.
To use GitHub Copilot, you must have an active subscription for GitHub Copilot in your personal account, or you need to be assigned a seat by your organization.
To use GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio Code, you must have the GitHub Copilot extension, which is installed from the Visual Studio Code marketplace.
GitHub Copilot offers code suggestions as you type, sometimes completing the current line and sometimes offering a whole new block of code.
You can enable or disable GitHub Copilot inline suggestions by selecting the GitHub Copilot icon in the Status Bar of Visual Studio Code and choosing the desired option.
The document provides information on how to use AI chat conversations with GitHub Copilot Chat.
The VS Code Copilot Series on YouTube offers programming-specific videos for using Copilot with Python, C#, Java, PowerShell, and more.
The GitHub Copilot documentation can be found at this link: <https://docs.github.com/copilot/getting-started-with-github-copilot?tool=vscode>.
The document provides information on how to use GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio Code.
The document provides links to additional resources for learning about Copilot and how to use it in VS Code.
